content: Read our presentation on the opportunity $MCD has to be a leader in the ESG movement. Our campaign can be an inflection point for sweeping change and a moment for shareholders to back up ESG platitudes with real action. https://bit.ly/MCDinvestorpresentation…

.@McDonaldsCorp’s Board must be held accountable for its significant ESG missteps, just as boards should be held accountable for financial underperformance. $MCD must make good on its +10 year promise. The only way to accomplish that is adding new perspectives to the boardroom.
Read our letter to stockholders of $SWX here: https://carlicahn.com/open-letter-to-southwest-gas-stockholders-16/…

My proxy fights at McDonald's & Kroger differed from most companies I target as an activist b/c both are performing well, financially. The issue of a lack of accountability remains the same however (in this case, treatment of workers & animals). Read more: https://carlicahn.com/statement-to-shareholders-of-mcdonalds-and-kroger/…

Looking forward to speaking with @nathanvardi during @MarketWatch's “Best New Ideas in Money Festival” today at 3:55pmET. Sign up with code [ICAHN100] at checkout for a complimentary virtual pass. https://on.mktw.net/3BwMmw4 #MWMoneyFestival
I will be speaking with @ScottWapnerCNBC on @CNBCOvertime today at 4 pm ET.

Thank you to all of the Illumina shareholders that voted for me. I look forward to serving on behalf of all shareholders and stakeholders. I am happy to say that activism is alive and well at Icahn. - Andrew Teno, Icahn Capital

I am happy to see all of the recent events occurring at Illumina. While obviously I believe the change of CEO should have come meaningfully sooner, it is still a very positive occurrence. The new additions to the board, the CEO transition, as well as the change of the Chairman,…
I spoke to Illumina’s new CEO, Jacob Thaysen. I think he will do an excellent job and he has my full support.
